As Executive Vice President of Financial Strategy, I play a mission-critical role in developing corporate strategy by leveraging financial analytics as a vital component of business decisions. In this role, I work closely with our data science team to roll out new financial dashboards for senior management. 

Some of the main ways in which I have made a difference include:

► Drove one of Blockchain’s largest product launches ever by establishing operational infrastructure, operational processes, banking relationships, and new risk management procedures to manage liquidity for rollout of company’s 1st cryptocurrency exchange. Projected to generate significant revenues within next 18 months.

► Launched company’s 1st venture capital fund, leading structuring and regulatory compliance.

Experiences.Company: Vice President Of Finance And Operations
Experiences.src:
Vice President Of Finance And Operations, Blockchain · Full-time, 2015 - 2019 · 4 yrs, Greater New York City Area, In this position, I effectively functioned as COO / CFO / General Counsel overseeing operations, finance, accounting, governance, legal, human resources, and facilities. I negotiated and structured contracts and term sheets with partners, investors, and acquisition targets while supporting growth from 3M to 42M+ users. I also managed a $30M+ annual operating budget.

My key contributions to the organization were:

► Modernized operational infrastructure, utilizing forensic accounting to construct historical financial statements, implementing quarterly reporting, and establishing payroll function (employees previously paid in bitcoin).

► Orchestrated mission-critical partnerships with Coinify, SFox, Unocoin, and ShapeShift, leveraging Blockchain’s 42M-user. 

► Built operational, legal, and technical foundation to launch 2 hedge funds in U.S. and OTC trading desk in U.K. for retail, high net worth, and enterprise brokerage platforms, enabling users to participate in cryptocurrency markets. 

► Spearheaded and presented financial projections and other investor materials, oversaw due diligence process, and structured term sheets to close $40M Series B round led by Google Ventures and Lakestar with a 3X post-money valuation from the Series A.

► Supported $125M airdrop devising legal, accounting, and taxation strategy to avert potential $30M tax liability.

Experiences.Position: Vice President of Finance and Inside Counsel
Experiences.src:
Vice President of Finance and Inside Counsel, GOPAGO (acquired by Amazon & Doublebeam) · Full-time, 2012 - 2013 · 1 yr, San Francisco Bay Area, GoPago was a cloud-based mobile payment platform with an integrated point of sale system and 108 employees.

In this position, I effectively functioned as COO / CFO / General Counsel, overhauling operational strategy, building financial forecasts, and overseeing regulatory compliance (BSA, OFAC, AML), legal affairs, data analytics & insights, human resources, stock administration, litigation, and intellectual property. I managed a 5-person team and supported the company’s rapid growth from 18 to 108 employees.

My most notable accomplishments included:

► Drove strategic pivot from initially serving as merchant of record and charging customers flat fee of 2.75% of transaction (regardless of interchange fees charged by credit card processors) to monthly subscription service with credit card fees passed directly to customer. Eliminated pricing risk and enabled GoPago to turn profit for 1st time. 

► Secured and executed $10M+ in debt financing with Series A investor (JPMorgan Chase).

► Led negotiations and deal structuring during acquisition by Amazon and DoubleBeam.

Motive offers a new, exciting, and intuitive way forward. We began by creating the Xander technology platform, on which we then built an emotion-enabled employee engagement solution, followed by Performance Management. Kanjoya builds technologies bringing human empathy into the customer and consumer experience, helping our partners build emotional connections with their audience. 

The goal of every great sales person, marketer, customer service representative and friend is to connect emotionally with the person they're communicating with. We've dedicated nearly a decade building proprietary, award-winning solutions that not only recognize and acknowledge how a person is feeling, but provide a better experience for them based on that knowledge. 

As in real-life, you can't buy emotional intelligence. We operate our own flagship social media property, Experience Project, which connects over 15 million people a month on over 35M+ shared experiences. EP is renowned as a dramatic departure from traditional social media, providing meaningful connections at scale. 80% of our users say the site has changed their life for the better, and our marketing partners-- including Wal-Mart, GM, and Coke-- rely on us to tell the story of their brand as a product of experiences, thereby humanizing the company in a genuine way.

From the unique attributes of EP, we have an enormous, proprietary, and continuously updated library of knowledge of how language, behavior, emotion and intent intersect. This yields a series of  algorithms, which can operate accurately anywhere people communicate to answer the question, "How does this person feel, and what does what they are saying mean?" 

We have a point solution for each step of the customer journey, from brand messaging to retention, extending the vision of empathy in technology to the enterprise world. 

As founder and CEO, I've done everything I can to enable our company to be successful, as I'm passionately obsessed with bringing our view of the world to mass market., Kanjoya and Twitter Co-Present the New Model of Employee Engagement, Kanjoya CEO Armen Berjikly and Twitter Director of People Analytics Shane McCauley took the stage at the HCI Summit in early April to present Twitter’s new model of employee engagement, powered by the Kanjoya Perception™ solution.
